entry.title: Azerbaijan cannot ignore Karabakh Armenians‚Äô rights: Iran‚Äôs envoy to Yerevan

media:group.media:title: Azerbaijan cannot ignore Karabakh Armenians‚Äô rights: Iran‚Äôs envoy to Yerevan
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan again said Yerevan hopes to sign a peace treaty with Baku in the near future, even as he questioned Azerbaijan‚Äôs commitment to the peace process. üìçPashinyan met with the chief prosecutor at the International Criminal Court, which Armenia formally joined last month in defiance of repeated warnings from Russia. üìçSpeaking exclusively with CivilNet, Iran‚Äôs ambassador to Armenia expressed his support for the rights of Nagorno-Karabakh Armenians, prompting Azerbaijan to issue a statement decrying the diplomat‚Äôs ‚Äúbaseless and provocative opinions.‚Äù

media:group.media:description:
The World Central Kitchen, founded by chef Jos√© Andr√©s, and the Armenian General Benevolent Union are working together to provide meals for forcibly displaced persons from Nagorno-Karabakh.The effort is long term and involves local community members, and even those who are themselves displaced.

entry.title: ‚ÄòStrong growth‚Äô in Armenia despite global economic troubles, IMF says: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: ‚ÄòStrong growth‚Äô in Armenia despite global economic troubles, IMF says: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìç2 million tourists visited Armenia in the first 10 months of the year, smashing the country‚Äôs all-time record for yearly visitors ‚Äî with two months in the year still left to go. üìçThe IMF plans to expand the amount of money available for Armenia to $73 million after reviewing the country‚Äôs economic progress. üìçArmenia‚Äôs economy minister sat down exclusively with CivilNet to talk about his vision attracting world-class investors to Armenia and turning the country into a high-tech hub.
